intro: Swertia columbiana f. albida, commonly known as the white swertia, is a rare and striking variant of the Swertia genus. This plant is characterized by its pale to white flowers, which contrast sharply with its green foliage. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas. The plant belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is native to specific regions in the Himalayas. Its unique coloration makes it a sought-after species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
